name: Surgical Embolectomy
description: Open surgical technique for removal of emboli and thrombi from arteries using a balloon-tipped catheter (Fogarty catheter). First described by Thomas Fogarty in 1963, remains the gold standard for acute arterial occlusion management.

history.innovation: First balloon-tipped catheter for arterial clot removal
history.impact: Revolutionized treatment of acute arterial occlusion

mechanism.catheter: Flexible catheter with inflatable balloon at tip
mechanism.technique: Insert deflated, pass beyond clot, inflate balloon, withdraw extracting clot
mechanism.principle: Balloon conforms to vessel lumen, engages and extracts clot

acute_limb_ischemia.thrombotic: Thrombosis of diseased artery or graft

access.common_femoral: Most common, allows proximal and distal access

procedure.repeat: Multiple passes until no further clot

tips: Multiple gentle passes better than one aggressive pass
Use appropriately sized catheter for vessel

adjunctive_procedures.fasciotomy: If prolonged ischemia (>6 hours), reperfusion injury expected

outcomes.amputation: Related to ischemia duration, delay in treatment

clinical_pearls: Fogarty catheter invented in 1963 - revolutionized ALI treatment
Size catheter to vessel - 2F tibial, 4F femoral, 6F iliac
Multiple gentle passes better than one aggressive pass
Consider fasciotomy if ischemia >6 hours - reperfusion injury expected
learning_objectives: Describe the Fogarty catheter technique for embolectomy
Select appropriate catheter size for different arterial locations
